DataElement.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Impaired Circulation in Arm or Leg Symptoms Interfere with Life 3 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much circulation trouble in arms or legs interferes with their activities, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Arm Or Leg Circulatory Impairment Symptoms Interfere with Life
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function._A question about whether an individual currently has a disease._The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support._The movement of blood to and from the heart and to the rest of the body's organs, tissues, and cells through the network of arteries, veins, and capillaries. (NCI)_Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function._A question about an individual's feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Concepts.longName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
Concepts.definition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Property.preferredName: Have Current Illness Arm Or Leg Blood Circulation Impairment Symptoms Interfere with Life
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.:The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.:The movement of blood to and from the heart and to the rest of the body's organs, tissues, and cells through the network of arteries, veins, and capillaries. (NCI):Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.:A question about an individual's feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.
The movement of blood to and from the heart and to the rest of the body's organs, tissues, and cells through the network of arteries, veins, and capillaries. (NCI)
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.
A question about an individual feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
